page.title: 12POST & TELEPHONES -W.LEEDS
page.content: {THE POST-}Mr. Robinson is a postman. He starts work at the Wortley District Sorting Office at 5.00 a.m. The mail for delivery has already arrived from Royal Mail House in the city centre. The postmen first sort the mail into sets, then each postman sorts his letters in to order for each street. Then the mail is delivered to over 16,000 addresses in the area. Later, three vans deliver the parcels. { THE TELEPHONE EXCHANGE-}Wires from over 15,000 telephones in the district enter the cellar in the Exchange into thick black cables. Air is pumped into the cables to prevent water entering damaged cables.The 63.... numbers are on a mechanical exchange whilst the 79.... numbers are on an electronic exchange. We saw flashing lights, lots of wires, meters, a big computer, huge emergency batteries and a generator.
